Can you try with all options selected under DPI Bypass?
If that still does not work, you can try to enable the Use Stealth DPI driver.

If that does not work please collect a set of logs following the steps below.
1. Download the archive to an empty folder at the following link:
 https://download.endpointprotector.com/Support_files/Support_Tool_V2.zip
2. Unzip the sub-archive corresponding to the client computer's operating system.
3. Double-click the EPPSupportTool_64 or _32.exe file. This opens a dialog box.
4.a. Select Create Log file and click Execute.
4.b. Select Create DPI Log file and click Execute.
This creates a file called eppclient.log and sslsplit.log in the root directory of the C: drive.
5. Right-click the EPP client and click "Update Policies Now".
6. Try to access the app.
7. Open EPPSupportTool and click Export Files. This will copy files to the current folder.
8. Send me the created files (archived) so that we can investigate them further.

Kind regards
